page.title: 12LITTLEPORT CHURCHES
page.content:
Although parts are older, the present {St. Georges Church}dates from the fifteenth century. The vicars can be traced to 1250. The tower is 23 metres high. The Littleport{Fair}and{Feast are in the Summer, due to difficulties crossing the waterlogged fens on the Saint's day. There used to be 3 parishes and 4 clergy, but these have been reduced to one of each. About 100 people actively support the church. The latest development is the conversion of the North Aisle into {Parish Rooms.}
The other churches are Methodist, Salvation Army, Evangelical and Gospel Hall. Each have a similar sized active support to the Church of England. The {Methodists}could lose their minister in two years.
